docs.snippet: In the final weeks of his presidential campaign, Donald Trump is countering allegations of his own sexual misconduct by recounting accusations against former President Bill Clinton....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the final weeks of his presidential campaign, Donald Trump is countering allegations of his own sexual misconduct by recounting accusations against former President Bill Clinton.

headline.main: For Donald Trump, Low-Turnout Strategy Unlikely to Work
headline.print_headline: For Donald Trump, Low-Turnout Strategy Unlikely to Work

docs.snippet: U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump on Friday accused Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim of trying to help Democrat Hillary Clinton win the Nov. 8 election through his connection to the New York Times....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump on Friday accused Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim of trying to help Democrat Hillary Clinton win the Nov. 8 election through his connection to the New York Times.

headline.main: Trump Accuses Mexico's Carlos Slim of Trying to Help Clinton
headline.print_headline: Trump Accuses Mexico's Carlos Slim of Trying to Help Clinton

docs.snippet: A 40-year-old Brigham Young graduate has little money and no major-party backing, but he holds a certain appeal for “Never Trump” conservatives....
docs.lead_paragraph: A 40-year-old Brigham Young graduate has little money and no major-party backing, but he holds a certain appeal for “Never Trump” conservatives.
docs.abstract: Presidential candidate Evan McMullin has been drawing large crowds in Utah and has been gaining support in polls, mostly from Mormons and Republicans, which has put him within striking distance of victory in state; McMullin has almost no shot of winning presidency, as he is on only 11 state ballots, but he could make history if he manages to win Utah.

headline.main: Evan McMullin’s Moonshot White House Bid Has Utah’s Attention
headline.print_headline: Utah Man Slowly Gains Notice as a Conservative Alternative to Trump

docs.snippet: Democratic presidential contender Hillary Clinton leads rival Donald Trump by seven percentage points, according to a Reuters/Ipsos national opinion poll taken as the Republican nominee fought off accusations of groping women....
docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic presidential contender Hillary Clinton leads rival Donald Trump by seven percentage points, according to a Reuters/Ipsos national opinion poll taken as the Republican nominee fought off accusations of groping women.

headline.main: Clinton Leads by 7 Points as Trump Faces Grope Claims: Reuters/Ipsos Poll
headline.print_headline: Clinton Leads by 7 Points as Trump Faces Grope Claims: Reuters/Ipsos Poll

docs.snippet: With Donald Trump on the defensive, Hillary Clinton says she is taking "no satisfaction" in his actions and promising to repair the damage and project a message of unity during the campaign's final weeks....
docs.lead_paragraph: With Donald Trump on the defensive, Hillary Clinton says she is taking "no satisfaction" in his actions and promising to repair the damage and project a message of unity during the campaign's final weeks.

headline.main: Clinton Says She Takes 'No Satisfaction' in Trump's Actions
headline.print_headline: Clinton Says She Takes 'No Satisfaction' in Trump's Actions

docs.snippet: Some key Republican officeholders and candidates are reaffirming their support for Donald Trump despite new allegations from women that he groped and assaulted them. The Republicans argue that Trump would still be better on key issues like energy ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Some key Republican officeholders and candidates are reaffirming their support for Donald Trump despite new allegations from women that he groped and assaulted them. The Republicans argue that Trump would still be better on key issues like energy and the Supreme Court than Democrat Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Some Republican Officials Stick With Trump, Cite the Issues
headline.print_headline: Some Republican Officials Stick With Trump, Cite the Issues

docs.snippet: Hacked emails published by Wikileaks this week appear to show Qatar pledging to donate $1 million to Hillary Clinton's family's charitable foundation, despite her promise to curb new donations by foreign governments while U.S. secretary of state....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hacked emails published by Wikileaks this week appear to show Qatar pledging to donate $1 million to Hillary Clinton's family's charitable foundation, despite her promise to curb new donations by foreign governments while U.S. secretary of state.

headline.main: Hacked Emails Raise Possibility of Clinton Foundation Ethics Breach
headline.print_headline: Hacked Emails Raise Possibility of Clinton Foundation Ethics Breach

docs.snippet: House Speaker Paul Ryan did it again Friday — he spoke about the choices in this year's elections without uttering the words "Donald Trump."...
docs.lead_paragraph: House Speaker Paul Ryan did it again Friday — he spoke about the choices in this year's elections without uttering the words "Donald Trump."

headline.main: Ryan Plugs GOP Campaign Agenda, but No Mention of Trump
headline.print_headline: Ryan Plugs GOP Campaign Agenda, but No Mention of Trump

docs.snippet: Rolling his eyes at the Republican nominee, President Barack Obama mocked Donald Trump's purported business acumen and newfound rage against the "global elite," as he rallied Friday for Democrat Hillary Clinton. He warned that democracy itself was...
docs.lead_paragraph: Rolling his eyes at the Republican nominee, President Barack Obama mocked Donald Trump's purported business acumen and newfound rage against the "global elite," as he rallied Friday for Democrat Hillary Clinton. He warned that democracy itself was at risk if Trump wins.

headline.main: 'Come on, Man,' Obama Says, Rolling His Eyes at Trump
headline.print_headline: 'Come on, Man,' Obama Says, Rolling His Eyes at Trump
